description: ERECTION OF FIRST FLOOR REAR EXTENSION.
decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The proposed first floor rear extension, by reason of its mass, would be harmful to the character and appearance of the dwelling, due to the disproportionate scale of the extension, in comparison with the overall size of the site and the main dwelling. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy D4 of the London Plan (2021), Policy CS14 of the Core Planning Strategy (2011) and Policies DMD2 and DMD3 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan (2014).

Reason : 2 - The proposed first floor rear extension, by reason of its mass, would be harmful to the residential amenity of the neighbouring dwellings, due to the extension's projection beyond the rear elevations of the neighbouring properties and the height of the eaves and ridge line heights creating an overbearing effect and obstructing the ingress of natural light to the neighbouring sites. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy DMD2 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan (2014).

Reason : 3 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
"	As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.
In this instance:
"	The application was considered to be fundamentally contrary to the provisions of the Development Plan and the NPPF, and there were not considered to be any solutions to resolve this conflict. 
"	It is noted that the applicant/agent did not engage in any pre-application discussions.
"	The applicant is advised to seek pre-application advice on any resubmission.
